snippet: The Kaveri River dispute shows that the Center’s power to resolve tensions between states has diminished.
abstract: The Kaveri River dispute shows that the Center’s power to resolve tensions between states has diminished.
lead_paragraph: “Karnataka does not wish to be so generous with precious fresh water and resents” that India’s federal government is coercing it to be so, Manu Joseph wrote in The New York Times about a strike last Saturday in the southern state’s capital of Bangalore called by several political and cultural pressure groups. “Their action was a protest against Prime Minister Manmohan Singh’s order to the state to release about 250,000 liters, or 66,000 gallons, of water per second from the Kaveri River to the neighboring state of Tamil Nadu,” he wrote.

headline.main: Two States Split Bitterly by One River
